bmr.title: Data for baseline calorie burn estimate
bmr.description: This information is used to calculate your baseline calorie burn for accurate weekly weight gain/loss predictions.

goal.title: Goal Type and Daily Goal
goal.description:
Set your goal type and daily target.
- Fixed Intake: Only food calories count toward your goal.
- Fixed Net Calories: Food minus exercise calories count toward your goal.
- Percent body weight - Cutting (Losing weight): 
  - Daily goal calculated based on desired weight loss and baseline calorie burn.
  - Recommend goal of 0.5-1.0% body weight per week
  - For example, if you choose 0.9% per week, a daily calorie goal would be calculated to help you lose about {weekly_loss} {units} per week, and would be updated as you lose weight.
  - Choosing more than 1.0% body weight per week will put you at high risk of losing lean body mass, which is counter productive
  - Ensure you are eating enough protein and strength training to avoid muscle atrophy while cutting
- Percent body weight - Bulking (Gaining Weight):
  - Daily goal calculated based on desired gain and estimated caloric needs.
  - Recommended goal of 0.25-0.5% of body weight per week
  - For example, if you choose 0.4% per week, a calorie goal would be calculated to help you gain {weekly_gain} {units} per week, and would be updated as your weight changes.
  - Chooseing more than 0.5% would put you at risk of gaining excess fat
  - Recommended protein intake 0.8-1.0 g protein per pound of body weight

neat.title: Activity Multiplier
neat.description:
Your amount of calories you burn is highly dependent on how active you are.
This multiplier is used to estimate the calories burned from your daily routine.

NOTE - Do not double count workouts. If you plan to manually log workouts, do not include them in this estimate.
- 1.1: Use 1.1 if you plan to manually log all exercise (e.g. calories burned from a daily step counter).
- 1.2: Low activity (desk work, <5,000 steps/day)
- 1.275: Light activity (5,000-7,500 steps/day)
- 1.35: Moderate activity (7,500-10,000 steps/day)
- 1.425: High activity (10,000-12,500 steps/day)
- 1.5: Very active (15,000 steps/day)

Choose a value that best matches your typical day. This helps improve the accuracy of your weight gain/loss predictions.
